name: Vegan Chana Masala/Chole (Chickpea Curry)
description: This is the Best Vegan Chana Masala you will ever make! Learn to make the Sour, tomatoey and thick sauce. chickpea curry. gluten-free soy-free Indian.
recipeIngredient: 1 inch ginger chopped (can be substituted with ginger paste)
3-4 cloves of garlic peeled and chopped (can be substituted with garlic paste)
1/2 teaspoon red chili flakes or green chili (to taste)
14 oz garbanzo beans washed and drained ( or 1 cup dry chickpeas soaked overnight and pressure cooked for 4-5 whistles.)
1 teaspoon Chana Masala powder or to taste (Recipe below or use the chana/chole masala blend from indian store.)

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender, add 3 medium chopped tomatoes, ginger, garlic, chili, lemon juice, 1/4 can garbanzo beans(1/4 cup cooked chickpeas). Blend into a paste and keep aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a blender, add 3 medium chopped tomatoes, ginger, garlic, chili, lemon juice, 1/4 can garbanzo beans(1/4 cup cooked chickpeas). Blend into a paste and keep aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a pressure cooker, add oil and onions. Switch on saute or over medium heat if it is a stove top pressure cooker.
recipeInstructions.name: In a pressure cooker, add oil and onions. Switch on saute or over medium heat if it is a stove top pressure cooker.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook until onions are translucent. Add in the spices, asofetida, chana masala blend and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook until onions are translucent. Add in the spices, asofetida, chana masala blend and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the tomato puree and cook on medium low, partially covered with occasional stirring until the paste thickens and starts to leave oil (about 15 minutes)
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the tomato puree and cook on medium low, partially covered with occasional stirring until the paste thickens and starts to leave oil (about 15 minutes)

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the salt and remaining garbanzo beans and 1 to 1.5 cups water depending on your preference for thick or thin curry.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the salt and remaining garbanzo beans and 1 to 1.5 cups water depending on your preference for thick or thin curry.

recipeInstructions.text: Pressure cook for 2 whistles(10 minutes). or cook covered until chickpeas are easily mashable.
recipeInstructions.name: Pressure cook for 2 whistles(10 minutes). or cook covered until chickpeas are easily mashable.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the pressure cooker release pressure by itself(5 minutes). Adjust salt. Add more chana masala blend and chili flakes per taste. Mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Let the pressure cooker release pressure by itself(5 minutes). Adjust salt. Add more chana masala blend and chili flakes per taste. Mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot topped with chopped onions, lemon wedges, cilantro and Rotis or Naans or Basmati Rice!
recipeInstructions.name: Serve hot topped with chopped onions, lemon wedges, cilantro and Rotis or Naans or Basmati Rice!

recipeInstructions.text: Saucepan: Use canned or slow cooker cooked chickpeas, or dry chickpeas soaked overnight. In a deep pan, make the tomato onion mixture as above. Add the chickpeas and 2 cups of water and cook for an hour or so, covered, until the chickpeas are tender. Mash some chickpeas and let cook for another 5-10 minutes uncovered. Adjust water for preferred consistency.
recipeInstructions.name: Saucepan: Use canned or slow cooker cooked chickpeas, or dry chickpeas soaked overnight. In a deep pan, make the tomato onion mixture as above. Add the chickpeas and 2 cups of water and cook for an hour or so, covered, until the chickpeas are tender. Mash some chickpeas and let cook for another 5-10 minutes uncovered. Adjust water for preferred consistency.

keywords: chickpea curry, traditional Indian meal, vegan curry recipe
